subject: AI
title: Types of AI Harm
description: A taxonomy of how AI systems can cause damage.

hook.text: AI harm isn't one thing ‚Äî it's a spectrum. From annoying (bad movie recommendation) to devastating (denied medical coverage by an algorithm).

buildup.text: Categories: allocation harm (unfair resource distribution), quality-of-service harm (worse performance for some groups), stereotyping, denigration, over/under-surveillance, and economic harm.

discovery.text: The same AI system can cause different harms to different groups: a loan model that works great for majority populations but poorly for minorities isn't 'working' ‚Äî it's discriminating.

twist.text: Some harms are invisible to the people building the system. You won't notice the model performs worse in another language if your team only tests in English.

climax.text: Audit for harm proactively. Don't wait for affected users to report problems ‚Äî they may not have the access or platform to do so.

punchline.text: The harm you don't test for is the harm that reaches production. Audit for all categories.

quiz.question: Why might some AI harms go undetected by development teams?
options: Teams may only test for their own demographics and languages, missing failures for other groups
